newsitem.title: USA: Johnson Controls completes Prince takeover.
newsitem.headline: Johnson Controls completes Prince takeover.

text.p: Johnson Controls Inc said Tuesday it completed the previously announced acquisition of privately held Prince Automotive for about $1.35 billion in cash.

Prince Automotive, based in Holland, Mich., is expected to have 1996 sales of about $850 million. It is a supplier of interior systems and components including overhead systems and consoles, door panels, visors and armrests.
Johnson Controls markets automotive seating and interior systems as well as plastic packaging and automotive batteries.
